author: pauld.9606
content:
<@!364458974906548225> You are writing a grammar using the notation of an algorithm. I would define it as one or the other. So the algorithm could look like:

```
Algorithm PackNextChunk
inputs: tail_length:uint5, tail_path_as_int:u25, common_length:uint5
output: tail_length | tail_path_as_int<<5 | common_length << (5 + tail_length)
        Where `|` is the logical or operator, << is the left bit-shift operator, and + is addition.
```

Or you can define it as a grammar (slightly different encoding for convenience):

```
encoded_path := common_length:<uint5> tail_length:<uint5> tail_path_as_int:<uint32> 
                where common_length+tail_length==25 and length(tail_path_as_int)==tail_length
uint5 := 0 | 1 | ... | 31
uint32 := 0 | 1 | ... | 2^(32)-1
```
